channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Health agencies lose staff in key areas as Trump firings set in
item.description: As the dust settles from the first wave of firings at health agencies, here's how many people got cut, and the impact of the roles that were lost.
item.content:encoded:
As the dust settles from the first wave of firings at health agencies, here's how many people got cut, and the impact of the roles that were lost.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: A Delta Air Lines passenger jet flips upside down during turbulent landing in Toronto
item.description: Authorities said that there were no fatalities, but at least eight people sustained injuries when the regional jet overturned while landing at Toronto's Pearson International Airport on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Authorities said that there were no fatalities, but at least eight people sustained injuries when the regional jet overturned while landing at Toronto's Pearson International Airport on Monday.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Mexico's President Sheinbaum threatens to take legal action over the Gulf name change
item.description: Earlier this month, Sheinbaum shared a letter addressed to Google with reporters, arguing that the U.S. had no authority to unilaterally rename the Gulf.
item.content:encoded:
Earlier this month, Sheinbaum shared a letter addressed to Google with reporters, arguing that the U.S. had no authority to unilaterally rename the Gulf.

(Image credit: ALFREDO ESTRELLA/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: Peace Talks with Russia; Mexican Street Sweeper Becomes a Star
item.description:
Members of the Trump Administration will meet with counterparts from Russia this week to discuss a possible peace deal with Ukraine. Notably, the Ukrainians are absent from these talks. Other European nations are also not invited, even though as a whole Europe gives Ukraine more aid money than the United States. We get updates from three NPR reporters covering various parts of the story.

And we meet a street sweeper in Mexico with a golden voice who became an overnight pop star.
item.content:encoded:
Members of the Trump Administration will meet with counterparts from Russia this week to discuss a possible peace deal with Ukraine. Notably, the Ukrainians are absent from these talks. Other European nations are also not invited, even though as a whole Europe gives Ukraine more aid money than the United States. We get updates from three NPR reporters covering various parts of the story.

And we meet a street sweeper in Mexico with a golden voice who became an overnight pop star.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: 4 top aides to New York City Mayor Eric Adams resign
item.description: The news from the longtime aides — Maria Torres-Springer, Anne Williams-Isom, Meera Joshi, and Chauncey Parker — comes after the Justice Department moved to drop corruption charges against Adams.
item.content:encoded:
The news from the longtime aides — Maria Torres-Springer, Anne Williams-Isom, Meera Joshi, and Chauncey Parker — comes after the Justice Department moved to drop corruption charges against Adams.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: In Chicago, cognitive behavioral therapy shows promise curbing youth violence
item.description: The program, which focuses on mentoring and therapy, relies on the idea that most violent crimes are emotional, not rational.
item.content:encoded:
The program, which focuses on mentoring and therapy, relies on the idea that most violent crimes are emotional, not rational.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Frigid temperatures and snow are expected across the U.S. this week
item.description: A high-pressure system is pushing Arctic air into the central U.S. this week. Much of the country will experience plunging temperatures, while states such as Kansas and Missouri could see heavy snow.
item.content:encoded: A high-pressure system is pushing Arctic air into the central U.S. this week. Much of the country will experience plunging temperatures, while states such as Kansas and Missouri could see heavy snow.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: When online weight-loss drugs are too good to be true
item.description: A telehealth company partnered with a pharmacy that lacked a required license, raising doubts about the safety and efficacy of the weight-loss medicines it mailed to patients.
item.content:encoded: A telehealth company partnered with a pharmacy that lacked a required license, raising doubts about the safety and efficacy of the weight-loss medicines it mailed to patients.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Power lines sparked new fires in LA after the Eaton Fire began, radio traffic shows
item.description: First responder communications show the power company in Altadena was slow to respond to Eaton firefighters — and that live power lines sparked new fires days after flames first broke out.
item.content:encoded:
First responder communications show the power company in Altadena was slow to respond to Eaton firefighters — and that live power lines sparked new fires days after flames first broke out.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Chiara Eisner

item.title: Pope Francis' hospital stay is extended due to 'polymicrobial infection'
item.description: The 88-year-old pontiff was initially admitted to the hospital on Friday for bronchitis. On Monday, the Vatican said test results show Francis has "a polymicrobial infection of the respiratory tract."
item.content:encoded:
The 88-year-old pontiff was initially admitted to the hospital on Friday for bronchitis. On Monday, the Vatican said test results show Francis has "a polymicrobial infection of the respiratory tract."

(Image credit: Mondadori Portfolio)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim
